Create a "Rules of the Day" board game: In this game, players take on the role of children ruling the world. The board is divided into different areas, each representing a different aspect of society, such as education, healthcare, and entertainment. Players roll dice to determine how many spaces they can move each turn, and they must follow the rules and regulations posted on the board for each area. For example, if a player lands on the education space, they must draw a card with a learning activity, such as solving a math problem or reading a book, and complete it before moving on. The first player to complete all the activities on the board wins the game.

Host a "Kid-Friendly Congress" event: Invite children from the local community to participate in a mock congressional session. Divide the children into groups based on their interests, such as environmental issues, social justice, and economic development. Each group will research and prepare a proposal for a "bill" that they will present to the "Congress." The proposals will be judged by a panel of adults, and the winning group will receive a prize. This event will encourage children to take an active role in shaping their future and make their voices heard.

Create a "World Problem-Solving Challenge": Divide the children into teams and give them a series of complex problems to solve, such as climate change, poverty, and inequality. The teams will work together to brainstorm and present their solutions, and a panel of judges will evaluate their proposals based on feasibility, creativity, and impact. The winning team will receive a prize and their solution will be implemented in a real-world setting.

Host a "Kid-Friendly Art Exhibition": Encourage children to create artwork that reflects their vision of a perfect world. The artwork can be in any medium, from painting and drawing to sculpture and photography. The exhibition will be held in a local gallery or museum, and a panel of judges will select the best pieces. The winners will receive prizes, and their artwork will be displayed in a permanent collection.
